TPIN.question: If I verify with TPIN, will it sell all my holdings?
TPIN.answerHtml:
No. Once you verify via TPIN by CDSL, it only verifies your existing holdings so that you can place your sell order whenever you want in a secure manner. 
The approval is valid for 1 day for your Demat account after which you will require to verify again.

We assure you that no sell order will be placed without your approval.

Frequently Asked.question: How do I verify via Aadhaar (eSign)?
Frequently Asked.answerHtml:
You can verify via Aadhaar by following these steps:

1. Go to the verification screen by clicking on the button below
2. Click on 'GO TO AADHAAR ESIGN'
3. You will receive a security code on your registered mobile number on Groww
4. Enter the security code and press 'SUBMIT'
5. Click on 'Sign Now'
6. Tick the box beside 'I hereby authorize...'
7. Enter your Aadhaar number
8. Press 'Send OTP'
9. Enter OTP you receive on your Aadhaar-linked mobile number
10. Click on 'Verify OTP'

Done!

Frequently Asked.question: My Aadhaar is not linked to my mobile number. How do I open an account?
Frequently Asked.answerHtml:
There's always a way! You can link your mobile number to your Aadhaar. Simply, follow the steps given in our blog.

There's another alternative. You can download the physical account opening form, print and sign it, and courier the signed form to the address mentioned in the form. Click on the button below to download the physical form.

Frequently Asked.question: How can I link my Aadhaar and phone number?
Frequently Asked.answerHtml: You can link your mobile number to your Aadhaar easily. Follow the steps given in our blog by clicking the button below.

Frequently Asked.question: How can I change the phone number linked to my Aadhaar card?
Frequently Asked.answerHtml:
Here are the steps:
 
 Step 1: Call 14546* from your mobile number
 Step 2: Select whether you are an Indian or an NRI
 Step 3: Re-verify Aadhaar by pressing 1
 Step 4: Type your 12-digit Aadhaar number and confirm it by pressing 1
 Step 5: An OTP will be generated and sent to the registered mobile number
 Step 6: Allow your operator to access your name, photo, and DOB from UIDAI
 Step 7: IVR will read out the last 4 digits of your mobile number
 Step 8: If correct, enter the OTP received
 Step 9: Press 1 to complete the process
 
 If this method doesn't work, click on the button below to read the blog explaining how to change the phone number linked to your Aadhaar card.
